instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2530-A - Green light but wont turn on
820-2530-A - Green light but wont turn on
threads.message: If you have PP3V3_S5 present, i guess should be a bad C7771

threads.title: 820-2530-A - Green light but wont turn on
threads.message:
Only 15" 2009 have that problem. 13" are unaffected by the cap plague. If 1.05v is present on C7771, you will have to start looking elsewhere.

Does PM_SLP_S4_L go up to 3.3v when you press power button? Do the rest of the power rails in the machine work? There's a lot more here than JUST PPBUS_G3H!

threads.title: 820-2530-A - Green light but wont turn on
threads.message: Voltage on pin 5 of U6901? Is it possible to power it on in SMC bypass mode? Remove power and battery, press power button and insert AC adapter, keep holding power button for another 5 seconds. Release it and press it again.

threads.title: 820-2530-A - Green light but wont turn on
threads.message: I have a question on this one. I do not get 3.3V when I press power. But if I put into SMC bypass I get 3.3V. (On PM_SLP_S4_L)
